Name: Mummiform shabti for Sethos I
Description: Mummiform figure with soft flowing contours and a rounded face with tripartite striated wig. The arms are crossed over the chest but no tools can be seen. The fine black outlining is for the most part covered by the thick dark glaze. There are six lines of the Book of the Dead chapter VI, but these are only partly legible. The shabti may come from the tomb of Sethos I in the Valley of the Kings.
